column3: would this require an upgrade in C++ STL? \nIf not, i think we should just upgrade to C++14 or something, because that replaces a lot of the things that boost currently has

> just upgrade to C++14

There is ongoing discussion on when the right time is to bump c++. It seems the plan is to skip c++14 and go straight to c++17, but it'll probably be a while: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/13356#issuecomment-537977292 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16684

Getting rid of Boost altogether is not likely to happen anytime soon, see e.g. https
As this doesn't bump the minimum required version of boost, just the one used in depends, it's ok with me.

> Boost 1.71 or newer is useful for #15382.\n\n[Release notes for Boost 1.71.0](https://www.boost.org/users/history/version_1_71_0.html) do not mention any change in `Process` library (required in #15382) at all. Did I miss something?
It fixes an unused variable, which is needed to pass Travis these days.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18677 (Multiprocess build support by ryanofsky)
* #10102 ([experimental] Multiprocess bitcoin by ryanofsky)

If you co

Given that the feature freeze is March 15th and there's still no new Boost release, 1.72 it is...\n\nShould I update the various boost related autoconf files too (haven't checked if there's new ones)?

Concept ~0. 

On the one hand, I think bumping a major dependency two versions to fix an unused variable in a module we don't even use, ["is useful for #15382. "](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17941#issue-363685467), is a bit ridiculous. Especially when, if required, it could be fixed quite easily in preprocessing. i.e: 

```diff
diff --git a/depends/packages/boost.mk b/depends

I don't think it's necessary to include this in 0.20. Let me word it differently: _if_ we want to bump Boost before the next release, then let's bump to 1.72. But otherwise I'll just leave this PR open until #15382 comes closer (with your patch as an alternative).\n\nI've been testing that PR and stuff built on top of it for a while and haven't seen any Boost issues, but I haven't specifically l
I switched to using @fanquake's workaround in my own PR. Given that Focal, the new LTS version of Ubuntu, ships with 1.71, it seems premature to bump to 1.72 unless there's a better reason.
